summary: This document is the plaintiff's answers to defendant Jeffrey Epstein's first set of interrogatories in civil case 08-CV-80811. It lists numerous individuals with knowledge of the case, including victims, law enforcement, prosecutors, and Epstein associates, while objecting to or providing limited answers to many personal questions. The plaintiff describes being paid for massages at Epstein's home from 2002-2003.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The defendant in the civil lawsuit, accused of sexual misconduct. The plaintiff describes being paid for massages at his home.

persons.name: Sarah Kellen
persons.context: Named as a co-defendant alongside Jeffrey Epstein in the civil lawsuit caption.

persons.name: Robert Critton
persons.context: Attorney for defendant Jeffrey Epstein, listed on the counsel list from Burman Critton Luther & Coleman LLP.

persons.name: Jack A. Goldberger
persons.context: Attorney for defendant Jeffrey Epstein, listed on the counsel list from Atterbury, Goldberger & Weiss, P.A.

persons.name: Bruce E. Reinhart
persons.context: Attorney for defendant Jeffrey Epstein, listed on the counsel list from Bruce E. Reinhart, P.A.

persons.name: Theodore Leopold
persons.context: Attorney for Jane Doe victims in related cases, listed as representing victims of Epstein.

persons.name: Isidro M. Garcia
persons.context: Attorney for a Jane Doe victim, listed as being with The Law Office of Brad Edwards & Associates, LLC.

persons.name: Jeffrey M. Herman
persons.context: Attorney for multiple Jane Doe victims in related cases, listed as representing victims of Epstein from Herman & Mermelstein, P.A.

persons.name: Jack Scarola
persons.context: Attorney for a victim (redacted case number), listed from Seamy Denney Scarola Barnhart & Shipley, P.A.

persons.name: Jack P. Hill
persons.context: Attorney for a victim (redacted case number), listed alongside Jack Scarola.

persons.name: Jose Alessi
persons.context: Identified as Jeffrey Epstein's butler, listed as a person with knowledge.

persons.name: Lanaa Belohavek
persons.context: Identified as being with the Palm Beach County Prosecutors Office, listed as a person with knowledge.

persons.name: Ghislane Maxwell
persons.context: Identified as an associate of Jeffrey Epstein, with an address listed for Ghislane Corp. in Palm Beach.

persons.name: Alfredo Rodriguez
persons.context: Identified as an employee of Jeffrey Epstein, listed as a person with knowledge.

connections.description: Listed together as defendants in the civil lawsuit case 08-CV-80811.
Robert Critton is listed as an attorney for defendant Jeffrey Epstein.
Jack A. Goldberger is listed as an attorney for defendant Jeffrey Epstein.
Bruce E. Reinhart is listed as an attorney for defendant Jeffrey Epstein.
Jose Alessi is identified as Jeffrey Epstein's butler.
Ghislane Maxwell is identified as an associate of Jeffrey Epstein.
Alfredo Rodriguez is identified as an employee of Jeffrey Epstein.
The plaintiff describes being paid by Epstein for massages at his home from 2002-2003 and is suing him.

events.title: Plaintiff introduced to Epstein
events.description: The plaintiff states she was introduced to Jeffrey Epstein by a friend in 2002 to give him a massage.

events.title: Regular massage sessions
events.description: The plaintiff states she went to Epstein's home on average twice a week, sometimes four times, from May/June 2002 to August 2003 to provide massages for payment.

events.title: Interrogatories propounded
events.description: Defendant Jeffrey Epstein served his first set of interrogatories on the plaintiff.

events.title: Answers filed with court
events.description: The plaintiff's answers to the interrogatories were signed and notarized, filed with the court.

locations: 345 South County Road, Palm Beach, FL 33480 (Palm Beach Police Department)
3580 Brillo Way, Palm Beach, FL 33480 (Ghislane Corp. address)
keyFacts: The plaintiff describes a pattern of visiting Jeffrey Epstein's home for paid massages 2-4 times per week from mid-2002 to August 2003.
The document lists numerous Jane Doe victims represented by attorneys Theodore Leopold, Jeffrey M. Herman, and others in separate federal and state cases against Epstein.
Epstein's staff, including butler Jose Alessi and employee Alfredo Rodriguez, are identified as persons with knowledge.
Ghislane Maxwell is explicitly listed as an 'Associate of Epstein' with a Palm Beach address.
The plaintiff objects to many interrogatories as irrelevant, including questions about her sexual history and detailed personal information.
